content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(year(x), lpad(month(x), 2, '0')), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` with a column `dt` of type `DateTime`, and creates a new column `ym` by extracting the year and month from each DateTime using the `year` and `month` functions from the `Dates` module, respectively. The resulting strings are then concatenated together as an integer in format "yyyymm" using string manipulation.

Note that the `lpad` function is used to pad the month with a leading zero if it has less than two digits, so that the resulting string always has the same length.
